titlestmt.titleproper: National Committee on United States-China Relations records, RG 2, Accession 2
A Guide to the National Committee on United States-China Relations records, RG 2, Accession 2 FA1184

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 17:07:25 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: National Committee on United States-China Relations records, RG 2, Accession 2

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: National Committee on United States-China Relations

physdesc.extent: 41.5 document boxes, 1 oversized flat box, 1 records storage box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: RG 2 of the NCUSCR records contains files documenting its sponsorship of Conferences, Seminars, Workshops, and Dialogues on foreign policy and relations with China, including U. S. - China Dialogues, which ran from 1984 to 2002. Files in the Programs, Projects, and Proposals series concern the U.S. - China Labor Law Cooperation project, 2002-2007, and the National Committee's University Field Staff program, 1966-1973. RG 2 also contains records of Exchanges to China through the Fulbright-Hays Summer Seminars Abroad, for the period 1982-2010, as well as a few general Exchanges files. A series of Personnel files is restricted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records of the National Committee on United States â€“ China Relations are divided into ten record groups, which reflect the order in which the records were received (but which are otherwise an artificial distinction). The records are sorted intellectually into series, which carry over through all record groups, but they have received little or no physical rearrangement. RG 2 of the NCUSCR records contains records from five series: 2 - Exchanges - General; 3 - Exchanges to China; 5 - Conferences, Seminars, Workshops, and Dialogues; 8 - Programs, Projects, and Proposals; 17 - Personnel records.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: Exchanges - General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Exchanges - General series in RG 2 is a small set of files that documents agreements between the National Committee and the U. S. Department of Education concerning the administration of Fulbright exchange programs with China. It also includes materials relating to conference presentations on the Fulbright teacher exchange experience.

did.unittitle: Exchanges to China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Exchanges to China series in RG 2 documents Fulbright-Hays Seminars to China from 1982 to 2010. This program, which the National Committee ran for the U. S. Department of Education and the Chinese Ministry of Education, sent sixteen American teachers (and sometimes post-secondary educators) to China each summer on a five-week study tour of Chinese history and culture, or in a few cases language training. Files include namelists, itineraries, reports, detailed program evaluations by the participants, and some of the curriculum projects that teachers created upon their return. In addition to the Fulbright seminars, the series also includes records of delegations of local and state education leaders who visited China in 1977 and 1978.

did.unittitle: Local Education Leaders Delegation: Report (Draft Pages)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original folder marked Draft 2, File 1. Presumably relates to photo essay "Children's Palaces: Education in the People's Republic of China as Photographed and Interpreted by American Educators." File consists of individual manuscript pages with attached photos. Includes the illustrated "Ballad of Leadership Local," by Lawrence Cremin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2003 group: Karinsa Moline, Music in China (2 cds); Leslie Martin, China Review; Cori Culp, Tour of China; Christy Schirmer; Ronnie Lynn Holley; Peggy Wenner; Catherine Mein, Palace Museum powerpoint. 2004 group: Jennifer Hall, Traditional Culture of China; S. Kay Mura, China Baroque; Lisa-Anne Culp; Shawn White; whole delegation CD. 2005: Kristina Kafka, Peking Opera; Irina Smith, Journey across China; Scott Schmidt; Peter Samaris; Heather Randolph; Jeffrey Garthee (3 CDs and 1 DVD); JoAnn Ellis; Lisa DosSantos (2 CDs). 2006: Kathy Callahan; Sheila Lantz; Despi Mayes, "The Art of the Brush," Museum Kit Resource Guide and Powerpoint slides; Leslie J. Sutton, Images of China (DVD); Karen Krause; Karen Arms; 1 unlabeled CD. 2007 - Language Training: Cathy Ream, An Introduction to Chinese Culture and History - Powerpoint of a Fulbright experience; Devra Miller, Chinese Students in California (2 CDs); Heidi Draheim; Hye-Young Kim; Virginia von Reichbauer (2 CDs); Jane Hayes; Flora Reichanadter; Laurel Cadwallader (2 CDs): Terri Toppler (2 CDs); Hiroko Kazama (4 CDs?); Carla Arnold, Trip photos, and The Monkey Emperor's Secret performances (4 CDs and 1 DVD). 2007 - History and Culture: Susan Casler; Denise Edelson (2 CDs); Linda K. White; Brian Jacobs; Devra Miller. 2009: Photos by Zhai Guanjun.

scopecontent.p: Photos of accommodations for Fulbright participants at Beijing Normal University (Beishida). 13 photos of rooms and 4 photos of Chinese men: Hu Min, Li Suosheng, Wang Yingjie, Li Huang.

did.unittitle: Conferences, Seminars, Workshops and Dialogues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Conferences, Seminars, Workshops, and Dialogues documented in RG 2 range in date from 1984 to 2006 and explore issues pertaining to China's emergence as a global player and engagement with China. Topics include Chinese foreign and economic policy, relations with Taiwan and Hong Kong, media coverage of China, and the future of U. S. â€“ China relations. The series particularly includes records of the U. S. â€“ China Dialogues (I â€“ XI, 1984 â€“ 2002), which the National Committee and the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs initiated as a way of facilitating frank and productive discussion of sensitive issues between the two countries.

did.unittitle: Programs, Projects, and Proposals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Programs, Projects, and Proposals series in RG 2 contains records of the NCUSCR's University Field Staff program, 1966-1973, which engaged graduate students and faculty in organizing workshops and other educational outreach programs on China on campus and in their surrounding communities.

The series also includes the records of the U. S. â€“ China Labor Law Cooperation Project, 2002-2007, a five-year project to improve labor laws in China, which the National Committee, together with the Asia Foundation and Worldwide Strategies, Inc., conducted under contract from the U. S. Department of Labor. National Committee involvement focused on drafting the Labor Contract Law and Regulations on Labor and Social Security Inspection. The Committee organized workshops in China, as well as U. S. study tours and internships for Chinese legislative and labor officials, and then developed a curriculum and training program for Chinese labor inspectors.
